sections.text:
RCW 62A.2A-514

Waiver of lessee's objections.

(1) In rejecting goods, a lessee's failure to state a particular defect that is ascertainable by reasonable inspection precludes the lessee from relying on the defect to justify rejection or to establish default:(a) If, stated seasonably, the lessor or the supplier could have cured it (RCW 62A.2A-513); or(b) Between merchants if the lessor or the supplier after rejection has made a request in writing for a full and final written statement of all defects on which the lessee proposes to rely.(2) A lessee's failure to reserve rights when paying rent or other consideration against documents precludes recovery of the payment for defects apparent in the documents.

(1) In rejecting goods, a lessee's failure to state a particular defect that is ascertainable by reasonable inspection precludes the lessee from relying on the defect to justify rejection or to establish default:

(a) If, stated seasonably, the lessor or the supplier could have cured it (RCW 62A.2A-513); or

(b) Between merchants if the lessor or the supplier after rejection has made a request in writing for a full and final written statement of all defects on which the lessee proposes to rely.

(2) A lessee's failure to reserve rights when paying rent or other consideration against documents precludes recovery of the payment for defects apparent in the documents.

[ 2012 c 214 s 904; 1993 c 230 s 2A-514.]

Application—Savings—2012 c 214: See notes following RCW 62A.1-101.

Application—Savings—2012 c 214: See notes following RCW 62A.1-101.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

RCW 62A.2A-514

Waiver of lessee's objections.

(1) In rejecting goods, a lessee's failure to state a particular defect that is ascertainable by reasonable inspection precludes the lessee from relying on the defect to justify rejection or to establish default:(a) If, stated seasonably, the lessor or the supplier could have cured it (RCW 62A.2A-513); or(b) Between merchants if the lessor or the supplier after rejection has made a request in writing for a full and final written statement of all defects on which the lessee proposes to rely.(2) A lessee's failure to reserve rights when paying rent or other consideration against documents precludes recovery of the payment for defects apparent in the documents.

(1) In rejecting goods, a lessee's failure to state a particular defect that is ascertainable by reasonable inspection precludes the lessee from relying on the defect to justify rejection or to establish default:

(a) If, stated seasonably, the lessor or the supplier could have cured it (RCW 62A.2A-513); or

(b) Between merchants if the lessor or the supplier after rejection has made a request in writing for a full and final written statement of all defects on which the lessee proposes to rely.

(2) A lessee's failure to reserve rights when paying rent or other consideration against documents precludes recovery of the payment for defects apparent in the documents.

[ 2012 c 214 § 904; 1993 c 230 § 2A-514.]

Application—Savings—2012 c 214: See notes following RCW 62A.1-101.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

RCW 62A.2A-515

Acceptance of goods.

(1) Acceptance of goods occurs after the lessee has had a reasonable opportunity to inspect the goods and:(a) The lessee signifies or acts with respect to the goods in a manner that signifies to the lessor or the supplier that the goods are conforming or that the lessee will take or retain them in spite of their nonconformity; or(b) The lessee fails to make an effective rejection of the goods (RCW 62A.2A-509(2)).(2) Acceptance of a part of any commercial unit is acceptance of that entire unit.

(1) Acceptance of goods occurs after the lessee has had a reasonable opportunity to inspect the goods and:

(a) The lessee signifies or acts with respect to the goods in a manner that signifies to the lessor or the supplier that the goods are conforming or that the lessee will take or retain them in spite of their nonconformity; or

(b) The lessee fails to make an effective rejection of the goods (RCW 62A.2A-509(2)).

(2) Acceptance of a part of any commercial unit is acceptance of that entire unit.

[1993 c 230 s 2A-515.]

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.

Effective date—1993 c 230: See RCW 62A.11-110.
